Eclectus

Eclectus Parrot

A medium-large parrot with extreme sexual dimorphism. Males are a brilliant emerald green with a candy-corn colored beak, while females are a stunning combination of bright red and royal blue/purple.

Origin
Australia & Oceania
Size
17-20 inches (43-50 cm). Weight: 380-475g (13.4-16.8 oz)
Weight
427g avg.
Noise Level
Moderate. Much quieter than most large parrots, making them suitable for many home environments. They have a range of calls, but are not constant screamers.

Looking for a Eclectus Parrot?

See Available Eclectus Parrot Listings

Species Ratings

Talking Ability 5/10
Noise Level 9/10
Social Needs 6/10
Cuddliness 5/10

Temperament & Personality

Generally calm, gentle, and intelligent. They are less prone to screaming than Amazons or Cockatoos. Females tend to be more dominant and territorial than the more easy-going males.

Vocalization & Talking Ability

Good talking ability with clear, pleasant voices. Both sexes can learn words and phrases, and can be quite chatty, though individuals vary.

Dietary Needs

A specialized diet with a heavy emphasis on fresh fruits and vegetables is crucial. They have a longer digestive tract and cannot handle many artificial ingredients or fortified pellets.

Health & Lifespan

Can live 30-50+ years. Prone to toe-tapping and wing-flipping if their diet is incorrect (too many vitamins/minerals). Sensitive to medications and artificial additives.

Housing Requirements

Large cage minimum 36"W x 24"D x 48". Bar spacing 3/4 to 1 inch. They are less destructive than many large parrots but still need plenty of toys.

Common Questions About Eclectus Parrot

What is the lifespan of a Eclectus Parrot?

The Eclectus Parrot typically lives for 30-50+ years. With proper care, diet, and regular vet check-ups, they can live a full and healthy life.

Is the Eclectus Parrot good for beginners?

This species is rated as 'advanced' care level. They require specific attention, socialization, or dietary needs that may challenge first-time owners.

Where does the Eclectus Parrot come from?

The Eclectus Parrot is native to Australia & Oceania.
